availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Blandville, Kentucky, saddler. Kentucky native. Married to Sally A. Watson. Father of Martha Watson, Thomas T. Watson, William L. Watson, Elizabeth Clementine Watson, Lucy M. Watson, Nancy M. Watson, and Hnery B. Watson. Saddler in Blandville in 1850 and 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard, Blandville, p. 276B. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard, Blandville, p. 562. Ballard County Kentucky Cemeteries, vol. 5 (Wickliffe, Ky.: Ballard-Carlisle Historical & Genealogical Society, 1995), p. 46. Find A Grave, "Wilson S. Watson (1820-1892)," Memorial #77290800, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=77290800&ref=acom (accessed June 16, 2017).
